Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/122.161.127.31|122.161.127.31]] to version by Locke Cole. False positive? [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot]]. (222725) (Bot)
/* History */ + [[High definition optical disc format war]]
/* Blu-ray Disc recordable */ Removing due to lack of citation.
/* Blu-ray Disc / HD DVD comparison */ Fixing Blu-ray BW figure so both formats are talking about the same type of number. Deleting Walmart, as it's mentioned in other interests
/* Digital rights management (DRM) */ AACS is not part of ROM-mark, AnyDVD is not playback software - deleted paragraph as I didn't see its purpose in the context. Also updated BD+ player issue
/* Codecs */ changing to more exact number - see http://www.videohelp.com/hd
/* Codecs */ max bitrate for audio/video on HD DVD is 30Mbps - 36Mbps is for additional data such as subtitles and mux etc. The BD equivalent of the 36mbps number is the 54mbps one.
/* Other interests */ WalMart dropping HD DVD, support BD exclusively
Toshiba is strongly considering dropping HD-DVD, companies are stopping support for the product. The "war" is over.
